name: Alan Jasanoff, PhD (PI)
bio: Alan is interested in mechanistic studies of neural function using brain-wide measurements and on tool development for molecular neuroimaging.

name: Agata Wisniowska, PhD
bio: Agata works on the twin problems of achieving high sensitivity and wide-field coverage with molecular imaging probes for MRI.

name: Ali Barandov, PhD
bio: Ali works on synthesis and application of small-molecule sensors for molecular fMRI, with particular emphasis on calcium imaging.

name: Ben Bartelle, PhD
bio: Ben is interested in bioengineering of novel probes and applications of cutting-edge molecular imaging in the nervous system.

name: He Wei, PhD
bio: He is a nanotechnology expert interested in applying nanoparticle-based imaging agents to measure molecular targets in the brain.

name: Jacob Simon
bio: Jacob works on a novel imaging agent architecture for ultrasensitive detection of neural signaling molecules.

name: Kevin Chung
bio: Kevin is interested in applying functional and molecular imaging for high resolution mapping of brain activity during behavior.

name: Miranda Dawson
bio: Miranda is a bioengineer working on novel strategies for genetic imaging and mapping plasticity related processes in the brain.

name: Miriam Schwalm, PhD
bio: Miriam focuses on application of novel imaging and recording techniques to study the brain-wide dynamics of neural activity.

name: Nan Li, PhD
bio: Nan studies brain circuitry using molecular imaging tools and conventional fMRI, with particular emphasis on functions of the reward system.

name: Pete Harvey, PhD
bio: Pete works on small molecule contrast agent synthesis and on wide-field delivery of imaging agents to the brain.

name: Robert Ohlendorf, PhD
bio: Robert works on developing probes that harness physiological processes to produce novel readouts in functional and molecular imaging.

name: Sarah Bricault
bio: Sarah studies drivers of resting-state brain activity, as well as neural dynamics involved in motivated behavior.

name: Souparno Ghosh, PhD
bio: Souparno is a bioengineer who focuses on genetically-encodable probes for functional imaging in the nervous system.
